title: The Method Matrix
story: Lists come with powerful methods that let you modify them! You can add items, remove them, sort them, and much more. These methods make lists incredibly flexible for storing and organizing data.
instructions: Create an empty list called `numbers`. Use append() to add 10, 20, and 30 to it. Then use insert(1, 15) to insert 15 at index 1. Print the final list (should be [10, 15, 20, 30]).
solutionHidden:
numbers = []
numbers.append(10)
numbers.append(20)
numbers.append(30)
numbers.insert(1, 15)
print(numbers)

tests.expectedBehavior: List should contain 4 elements after operations
Final list should be in correct order

hints.text: Start with empty list: []. Use list.append(item) to add to end
Use list.insert(index, item) to add item at specific position
numbers = [], append 10, 20, 30 in order, then insert(1, 15) to add 15 at index 1
